intro: Noccaea rostrata, commonly known as the rostrate watercress, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other edible and economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and small, bright green, alternate leaves. It produces yellow flowers in clusters, which are followed by small, round, hairy fruits. Noccaea rostrata is often found in moist soils near streams and waterways, thriving in temperate climates.
